hone.title: Intro to Bullet Journaling
hone.description: This workshop is for anybody and everybody who's every tried or wanted to start bullet journaling. Learn the basics of bujo and techniques to customize and optimize your journal.
hone.required: A fresh notebook, or spare paper, pens (optional: highlighters, brush pens)

hone.title: Intro to Illustrator
hone.description: In this demo-oriented workshop, we'll teach you the basics of Adobe Illustrator (pen tool, shapes, pathfinder) and how to use them to make vector images! We recommend that you have Illustrator downloaded on your computer prior to coming so you can follow along~!

explore.title: Isometric Design
explore.description: Learn how to create isometric illustrations to give some depth to your work! This workshop introduces the building blocks of isometric design, its different applications, and a step-by-step tutorial. Anyone with knowledge of basic Illustrator tools would be great for this workshop!

explore.title: Pixel Art
explore.description: Learn about the history and basics of pixel art (hint: it's not just for video games)!
explore.required: Any program that can do antialiased art: Aseprite, MSPaint, Photoshop, etc

explore.title: Merchandise Design and Production
explore.description: Curious about how to get your artwork from Photoshop onto everyone's laptops and water bottles? In this workshop, I'll be teaching you the basics of rendering designs for various merchandise including stickers, keychains, and buttons, as well as walking you through the steps of the post-production process.

explore.title: Designing for Inclusivity
explore.description: Design can't be appreciated universally unless it is accessible to everyone! We'll discuss general guidelines, specific processes, and develop a toolkit for evaluating and adjusting toward inclusive design in order to accomodate anyone who wants to admire your work.

explore.title: Slide Deck Design
explore.description: The best slide decks are ones that can convey information, and too often information is lost due to bad (or negligent) design. Learn how to create professional, delightful, and well-designed slide decks at this workshop! We'll be teaching how to apply visual design concepts directly to slide decks to make them more engaging.

hone.title: Intro to Lightroom
hone.description: This is an entry-level (no prior experience needed!), demo-orietnated workshop on the basics of editing a RAW file on Adobe Lightroom. The lesson will cover how to read a histogram, using sliders and tools, adjusting color, and everything else you need to know to get started with post-processing; come with Lightroom Classic downloaded on your computer!

hone.title: Mobile Phonetography
hone.description: The best camera is the one you have, and for many people that's their phone. In this workshop, you'll learn how to take and edit Instagram-worthy photos using just your smartphone.

explore.title: Building Comfort with Clients
explore.description: Being relational with your client is the magic behind portrait photography. Whether that client is a random person, a family member, or your roommate, come learn how to capture their character in a photograph.
explore.required: Any camera! Even a phone will work.

explore.title: Photo Collages with Photoshop
explore.description: Editing photos is not only limited to the photos themselves, but also using them in making compositions or collages.  So come and learn the basics of collaging and create your very own aesthetic vaporwave collages using photoshop!

explore.title: Photography Ethics
explore.description: This workshop will engage with critical thinking in an in-depth conversation on the ethics of photography before and after the shot (digital manipulation, engaging with subjects, photographing other cultures, etc.). The goal is to provide ethical literacy, giving you more tangible tools to be effective in your work while gaining access to relationships and communities in socially responsible ways.

explore.title: Intro to 35mm Film
explore.description: Film photography can feel like a daunting vintage world to enter, especially in the age of digital sensors and complex software. Come learn what you need to get started with 35mm photography!

explore.title: Maintaining Your Creative Confidence and Fighting Imposter Syndrome

hone.title: Intro to Adobe XD
hone.description: Learn the basics of Experience Design and how to bring your mobile and web prototypes to life using Adobe XD.

hone.title: Intro to Figma
hone.description: Ever wondered how User Interface mockups were made? Want more experience with User Experience and Interaction Design? Come out and learn the basics of Prototyping UIs on Figma! No prior experience needed.

hone.title: Intro to HTML/CSS
hone.description: Ever wanted the ability to make your own unique and personalized website? Come out and learn the basics of HTML and CSS, the foundational languages of the web! We will teach you what it takes to create a website from scratch.
hone.required: Laptop, text editor (ie. atom, vscode, sublime), Google Chrome

explore.title: Responsive Web Design
explore.required: Laptop, text editor (ie. atom, vscode, sublime)

explore.title: Audio Visualization with three.js
explore.required: Laptop, text editor (ie. atom, vscode, sublime)

explore.title: Intro to Processing and Processing Foundation
